question:
You have seen an advertisement for a community college that needs teachers for night classes. Write a letter to the community college. 
In your letter: 
say which advertisement you are answering describe which course(s) you want to teach, and what it/they would be about explain why you would be a suitable teacher
text: I am Surya, I am a teacher with the Master's in Computer Science and Engineering. I have recently noticed an advertisement for the requirement of a teacher at the community college. The college is located on the Elcamino road 10 meters from the bus stop.

I looked into college course work and came up with courses that interests me to teach. I am willing to take up courses in the field of computer science. The course offered will be on Artificial Intelligence because of its popularity among current trends, apart from that I like to teach the basics of Computer science and Operating System. The AI is mostly about the computer artifically learning to search/identify objects based on the models we train.

I strongly believe, I am the best fit for this position because of the qualification and the work experience in this field. Moreover, I have a Master's in Artificial Intelligence which makes me stand apart from the rest of the applicants.

error_list.error_des: It seems that there is an article usage problem here.
It appears that the noun Master's should not be in the possessive form. Consider changing it to the non-possessive singular or plural form.
It seems that there is an article usage problem here.
The word course work seems to be miswritten. Consider replacing it.
The singular verb interests does not appear to agree with the plural subject courses. Consider changing the verb form for subject-verb agreement.
It seems that System may not agree in number with other words in this phrase.
The word artifically is not in our dictionary. If you’re sure this spelling is correct, you can add it to your personal dictionary to prevent future alerts.
It appears that you have an unnecessary comma between the verb and object in your sentence. Consider removing it.
